parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I take to myself, (b) I take aside, (c) I welcome. From pros and lambano; to take to oneself, i.e. Use, lead, admit.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To be weak (physically: then morally), To be sick. From asthenes; to be feeble.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
Distinguishing; hence: deciding, passing sentence on; the act of judgment, discernment. From diakrino; judicial estimation.
From dialogizomai; discussion, i.e. consideration, or debate.
